name: natsem_tb3_indigenous_aurin_complete_data_geometr
title: SA2 Social Indicators for the Indigenous Population (Synthetic estimate) 2011

legal.attribution:
{datasource.organisationTitle}, ({dataset.attributionYear}): {dataset.title}; accessed from AURIN on {dateOfAccess}.

When using these data in published research, the authors need to include the following attribution in the text:
'These estimates are produced by NATSEM's Spatia Microsimulation model, which is described further in Tanton et al (2011)'

and the following in the bibliography:
Tanton, R., Vidyattama, Y., Nepal, B., & McNamara, J. (2011). Small area estimation using a reweighting algorithm. Journal of the Royal Statistical Society: Series A (Statistics in Society), 174(4), 931-951. DOI: 10.1111/j.1467-985X.2011.00721.x
legal.copyrightNotice: © University of Canberra - National Centre for Social and Economic Modelling {dataset.copyrightYear}
legal.additionalInformation: These estimates are from NATSEM's spatial microsimulation model and are based on estimated characteristics of the population. Such estimates are derived from the application of microsimulation modeling techniques to microdata based on sample surveys and the Commonwealth Census. These estimates may be different from the actual characteristics of the population because of sampling and non-sampling errors in the microdata and because of the assumptions underlying the modeling techniques. The microdata do not contain any information that enables identification of the individuals or families to which they refer.

abstract: The small area (SA2) estimates of indigenous social indicator in Australia. This is an outcome of a process that combines substantial geographic information from the latest 2011 Census with the rich variable detail of National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Social Survey (NATSISS) 2008. The model uses both these sets of data to gain reliable small area estimates of Indigenous social indicator. The indicators include participation in cultural activities; social capital; discrimination; health status; psychological stress; social and emotional wellbeing; financial stress; feelings of safety or stress; identification with clan, tribal or language group.

selectedAttributes.description: The mean of positive social and emotional wellbeing of Indigenous people aged 15 + (from -1 to 1) , 2011 based on spatial microsimulation estimate
